source.e9e3b870:
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from pandas import DataFrame
from sklearn import datasets
from sklearn.mixture import GaussianMixture
  
# load the iris dataset
iris = datasets.load_iris()
# select first two columns 
X = iris.data[:, :3]
# turn it into a dataframe
d = pd.DataFrame(X)
# plot the data
plt.rcParams["figure.figsize"] = (10,10)
fig = plt.figure()
ax = fig.add_subplot(projection='3d')
ax.scatter(d[0], d[1],d[2],c = 'b', marker='o')
plt.show()
source.e67469d9:
gmm = GaussianMixture(n_components = 3)
gmm.fit(d)
  
# Assign a label to each sample
labels = gmm.predict(d)
d['labels']= labels
d0 = d[d['labels']== 0]
d1 = d[d['labels']== 1]
d2 = d[d['labels']== 2]
  
# plot three clusters in same plot
plt.rcParams["figure.figsize"] = (10,10)
fig = plt.figure()
ax = fig.add_subplot(projection='3d')
ax.scatter(d0[0], d0[1],d0[2],c = 'red', marker='o',s=100)
ax.scatter(d1[0], d1[1],d1[2],c = 'yellow', marker='o',s=100)
ax.scatter(d2[0], d2[1],d2[2],c = 'green', marker='o',s=100)
plt.show()
source.d34157ab:
from sklearn.cluster import KMeans
kmeans = KMeans(n_clusters=3, random_state=0)
kmeans.fit(d)
labels = kmeans.predict(d)
  
d['labels']= labels
d0 = d[d['labels']== 0]
d1 = d[d['labels']== 1]
d2 = d[d['labels']== 2]
  
# plot three clusters in same plot
plt.rcParams["figure.figsize"] = (10,10)
fig = plt.figure()
ax = fig.add_subplot(projection='3d')
ax.scatter(d0[0], d0[1],d0[2],c = 'red', marker='o',s=100)
ax.scatter(d1[0], d1[1],d1[2],c = 'yellow', marker='o',s=100)
ax.scatter(d2[0], d2[1],d2[2],c = 'green', marker='o',s=100)
plt.show()
